topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1 Beta: Deploy the Standard Region using the HCG Dashboard (Standalone Denver Deployment)

p.b: If you are deploying a HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade onto a standalone KVM, follow the steps n this section.

body.p: Note: If you plan to deploy a KVM cluster with multiple servers for Service Availability (SA), see Deploying the Standard Region in a KVM Cluster.

After the lifecycle manager is installed, the next task in installing the Denver topology is to deploy the HP Helion OpenStack cloud. Follow the steps in this section to use the HCG Dashboard UI to perform the required tasks. Or, you can use the HLM CLI to perform these tasks.

The HCG Dashboard UI is a cloud management tool that allows users to define, deploy, manage, and monitor a HP Helion OpenStack cloud. The tool helps you provide and validate the cloud definitions required to deploy your cloud and guide you through the deployment.
The HCG Dashboard will be available as soon as the lifecycle manager is deployed. The dashboard service runs on port 8080 and can be accessed using http://<CLM_IP>:8080/.

ol.li: Launch a browser and navigate to http://<CLM_IP>:8080/.

Log into the HCG Dashboard. By default use
username: cghelion
password: cghelion
If this is the first time you have logged in, you will be prompted to change the password before you can continue. Once password is updated, you will need to log in again with newly created password.

section.title: Specify the cloud definition
section.p:
Use the Cloud Input wizard on the UI to:
Specify a name for the cloud:
Specify the Standard Region servers and map the servers to the controllers.
Validate the Standard Region servers for connectivity and credentials.
Specify network information for all required networks (CLM, API, BLS). If you do not have segment IDs, enter -1.
Validate the network information you provided.
Specify all required variables.
Specify information for any VSA and HP 3PAR storage backend configuration.
Note: There is no validation integrated for storage configuration with cloud.
Validate the DNS Server IP and NTP Server IP.
Click Finish to save all data in JSON files that will be used during the deployment.

body.section:
Deploy the cloud After you enter all necessary information for your cloud, you will be redirected to a page where you can see description and current status of your cloud. The page appears similar to the following:
Click DEPLOY to start deploying the cloud.
The deployment consists of four phases: provision, generate, netinit and deploy. As the phases progress, you will see the name of your cloud and current status at the top of the page and the marker on the wizard will move to the process as it completes.
To execute a particular process, you can click on a step and click Run. Once you hit the Run button, you will see your process being executed as shown below.Note: To execute a process, all previous processes must be completed.
The process runs asynchronously in background. section.title: Manage the cloud
section.p:
After the cloud is deployed, you can use the Manage Cloud wizard in the HCG Dashboard to reset services including:
MySQL
RabbitMQ
NTP
Apache
OpenStack services (Keystone, Glance, Swift, Cinder)
Centralized Logging services (ElasticSearch, Logstash, Kibana, Beaver, Icinga and Attis)
You can also edit an existing cloud definition for the Inventory Nodes.
